creditline: The Gary L. Gliem Endowment for Japanese Art
text: A light blue kimono streaked with silver, with phoenixes, bamboo, and flowers on the exterior. The phoenixes have lavender, yellow, orange, and green feathers, a white neck, yellow beak, and curling tail feathers in peach, white, light green, orange, purple, and dark green. The creatures fly around green bamboo with clusters of red, purple, and yellow leaves at the top, as well as paulownia trees with flowers in white and peach and leaves in yellow, green, and purple. The hem of the kimono is red and thickly stuffed. The sleeves are very long, about three quarters to the ground.
title: So-shibori juban (undergarment), from a five-piece wedding kimono set
